CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 25, 1962, pg. 9, reads: "D.I.'s Out-Of-Town Guests - Mrs. Mercedes Drafts (in center of picture, wearing black and white dress) is surrounded by several out-of-town guests who attended the D.I.s' benefit cabaret at the Holiday House. Mrs. Drafts is the aunt of Charles (Buggsy) Drafts, the young quadriplegic who was one of the beneficiaries of the affair.  Mrs. Drafts has raised the boy since he was a tiny tot. - Harris Photo"
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of nine women, including Mercedes Drafts, aunt of Charles "Buggsy" Drafts, in center of wearing black and white dress, and men, gathered at the Holiday House for the D.I.'s Pearl Bailey benefit cabaret
CatSubject_tab: Women--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Clothing and dress--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Holiday House (Monroeville, Pa).Charities--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Delightfully Insane Club Inc.Men--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.
